intro: Heyderia, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are shrubs native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink or purple. They possess evergreen leaves that are often leathery and arranged in whorls around the stems. Heyderia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
